Fields.DialogueText: What is that on your clothing?
Hm? Could you be more specific? I wear a number of unique accessories.
The patch on your clothing, the one with the two... bulls? It looks like a coat of arms...
Coats usually do have arms... what are you talking about? You're speaking absolute nonsense!

Fields.MenuText: Béarn is messing with you. She knows what you're talking about.
Are you messing with my crew?
There's a time and place for wit, Béarn.

Fields.DialogueText: Why do you spoil my fun?! I wanted to see how long I could keep this conversation going!
Maybe...There's nothing to do at the moment. What's wrong with having a little fun?
I'm just making sure the crew stays vigilant. Both physically and mentally!
If you must know, it's the coat of arms of my homeland! I wear it to show my support!
And Béarn is your home, right?
Bien sûr! The land of the Benearni back in the days of the Novempopulania!
I think she's gone back to the time of the Roman Empire. Just nod your head and play along.
The city was destroyed mercilessly by the Vikings, but came back bigger and better. Thus, Béarn was born!
I'm noticing a trend of breaking and rebuilding with you, Béarn.
@BATTLE
Resilience is my middle name.
You don't even have a surname.
Perhaps I shall find myself one!
... What?
Now, you could say that the province was really named for Beneharnum, the capital city of the Benearni...
These Morganas are not much of a challenge! Aux armes!
@BATTLE
Is it me, or are these Morganas getting worse at... Morgana-ing?
Well, they're ruthless in their numbers...
But they're so disorganized! Think about that last battle! They had no formidable defense and just kept throwing themselves at us!
The Morganas keep coming back, no matter how badly they're defeated. There is nothing more threatening than a foe that's incapable of wearing down.
Not to mention the way they get stronger with each defeat...
You folks have me! One of the toughest Belles out there! Let's just keep charging. I'm sure they'll flee in terror.

Fields.MenuText: We can't afford to wear ourselves out, Béarn.
A fight of endurance against the Morganas is a fight we can't win. We have to pick our battles carefully.
I know you're antsy to win this. But being reckless isn't the answer.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess you're right...
Maybe with some determination, willpower, and spirit, we can win!
It's not reckless! It's seizing an opportunity when we see one!
Béarn, you can't just fight willy-nilly. We have supplies, crew health, and maintenance to think of. I doubt the Morganas share those concerns.
Come on! It took ages for me to be built! The Société Nouvelle knew I'd be their masterpiece...
I thought the Great War kept them from working on you.
Exactement! Only the war to end all wars could hold me back!
Never change, Béarn...
Ha! Did you feel the wind on that shell, Capitaine?
Be careful, Béarn!
@BATTLE
Voici le Capitaine!
Well, that was quite the flourish. Is there anything special going on?
I'm just feeling some love about my home right now. So grateful to be such a unique Belle!
You are different, that's for sure.
In the best of ways. Both air and seas, I do it all! Oh? What's this? You're taking notice of my luxurious buttons on my clothing?

Fields.MenuText: Not really, Béarn. I'm just wondering when you'll start going off on a tangent.
They do look unique. But I'm not sure how this helps us in the war effort.
Sure. I'll bite. Okay, Béarn. What is with the button designs?

Fields.DialogueText: I'd never do such a thing! Every bit of information I give means something! I promise!
Don't be silly, Capitaine. How could fashion stop the Morganas? Are you trying to derail the conversation?
You might want to take a seat, mon capitaine! This may take a bit!
This is none other than one of the ancient Kings of France, Henri IV!
Okay, so-
A grand King! A King who turned Paris into a great city! Who ruled with weapon in hand and...
Béarn, you're rambling...
All right, I will skip to the end. Did you know he was assassinated?! Crazy, isn't it?
Oh, boy...
Nice work, Béarn! Great job clearing out the straggling Morganas!
Uh... Béarn?
Huh? Ah, bon! We won! Hurray for us! I'm thinking some brandy might be in order for everyone!
Are you okay, Béarn?
Hmm? Why? Do I seem not okay? Because I assure you, Capitaine, I'm fine!

Fields.MenuText: Usually you're a bit more talkative after a fight. You just seem bothered by something...
I'm not sure I believe that. Are you feeling ill? Strained? It's important that I know when you're not feeling great.
If you don't want to talk, that's fine. I'll be here if you need anything.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I was just...thinking! You know that I'm never in a sour mood, Capitaine!
I appreciate the concern, but I'm in top form! I always am! You can count me to get any job done.
Capitaine, you know that I always want to talk! Why would I never talk about something? Are you sure that you're not tired?
If you say so... are you still offering that drink?
Bien sûr! Come on, everyone! Let's stuff our faces with fine cuisine and booze!
*ALARM*
Once again...
@BATTLE
Capitaine! I need some input!
On what?
Well, my pilots do a lot of work around the ship. Other than fighting, they make sure everything is in top form.
They're good people, and I'm sure they keep looking forward to you spoiling them with wine.
Only for them, sir! But I think maybe that they are getting tired of it...

Fields.MenuText: Not sure I've ever heard of someone getting tired of wine...
I think they still appreciate it. Don't spoil them too much...
Just keep it at the wine. They have a job to do, Béarn.

Fields.DialogueText: But they are! I need to keep giving them surprises to show how generous I am! I want them to keep looking up to me!
You need to let the crew enjoy some of the finer things in life! Now hear me out!
I don't want them to lose their spirit! Come on, help me out here!
I think I have a solution...
What?
Béarnaise food! Of course! I can treat them to a refined meal! That would be a nice change. It would definitely get the taste of wine out of their mouths!
If you really want to do this, then I won't put my foot down. But you need to stay focused, Béarn.
I promise! But you don't have to take my word for it...
@BATTLE
Unbelievable. How is it that she's always late?
Can I have her fancy food? She's not around, I don't see her...
She'll be here... Béarn just loves to take her time...
If you say so... speaking of fancy dining, has Béarn been treating the pilots better than us?
She gives them wine sometimes...
What?! How come-
You wouldn't believe this! I gave one of the crew a history lesson!

Fields.MenuText: Is that why you're late?
I know you like to ramble, but I didn't think you'd try to teach.
Did they learn anything new?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not that late! It was an important manner!
History opens up people's perspective on life! They get a glimpse into what makes me gorgeous!
Well... he was nodding a lot... and at some point he just sorta seemed like he wasn't paying attention...
So about the wine...
You're interested in wine? I have some great stories about wine! Wanna hear them?
@BATTLE
Looks like it'll have to be later...
Capitaine! Notice anything special about me today?
Hard to say - what are you up to?
Notice any jewelry? A necklace, maybe?

Fields.MenuText: It looks like a plane. Where did you get this?
I'm still not noticing anything...
Did you get one for me?

Fields.DialogueText: I forgot that I had it lying around! It's one of my planes, the Dewoitine D.373.
Come on! I know you're joking! You can see that it's a pendant made to look like one of the planes stationed on the carrier!
Please, Capitaine. Such amazing items are meant for a true beauty like myself! Look at how it makes me more alluring...
I've been meaning to discuss the treatment of the rest of the crew with you.
A good leader is always concerned about their people! Why, Henri IV was constantly-
Focus, Béarn. It's about the wine.
Enemy Morganas inbound!
Let's get them, sir!
@BATTLE
We're not done here...
Capitaine, I must speak with you!
*ALARM*
You're going to have to hold that thought.
@BATTLE
Capitaine! We have an interesting problem here! It's about the crew and the wine!
I tried to tell you about it before... then you lost focus and-
Normally I don't need help in situations like these, but a woman of dignity and poise must yield every now and then!
If you say so.
Capitaine! What should I do to make the crew less jealous of the pilots?!

Fields.MenuText: You could stop giving the pilots wine.
I'm sure they'll understand. Your pilots mean a lot to you.
This is between you and them.

Fields.DialogueText: There isn't time to explain such insignificant details! Now, there has to be a way to please everyone!
I know, but...I don't want them to think I'm mean! I still respect them!
Really? Come on! This is an emergency!
I'll show off how much I care for the crew! Then they won't feel left out!
Just don't cause too much trouble...
By the way, Jurançon isn't cheap. How are you getting your hands on it?
Captain, Morganas approaching.
Sound the alarm.
@BATTLE
Allez! Try it!
I don't know... it seems a bit too fancy...
It's on me as thanks for all your hard work! I figured I could share my culture with you, and what better way than through food?
It looks expensive. How'd you get your hands on it?
Why does everyone ask that? It doesn't matter. Eat!

Fields.MenuText: As long as there's enough for me.
You're letting someone else try some Béarnaise food?
This is your plan?

Fields.DialogueText: Always, Capitaine! You are the guest of honor.
Of course! It's the least I could do! I let them see how great my culture is!
Shh. Don't spoil this, Capitaine!
It's time! Now eat up!
It's delicious!
Welcome to paradise! Aren't I the best?!
It's been quite a bit, mon capitaine!
Since what?
Since we shared a brandy together!
It has been a while... let's drink!
Now, let me tell you about my homeland.

Fields.MenuText: You already have, you know. Repeatedly.
You've never asked me about where I'm from, I should add.
Okay. I'm comfortable. Hit me.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, but that was just to stoke your curiosity! Now we get into the fine details!
I just assumed your life was meaningless before you came onboard.
Actually, one moment. I need more brandy before I begin.
You'd think by now I'd figure out what goes on in your head...
But you can't! I'm a mystery, Capitaine! It's what makes me so charming!
There's a certain charm in the irrepressible...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Naturellement!
...And the crazy.
Getting me fired up right before a fight, mon capitaine? Very clever...
...Yes. Let's go with that.
I don't know why I even bothered letting Béarn arrange a meeting...
Captain! J'ai une-eek!
There goes my coffee... Béarn, we have to talk about your tardiness. And your clumsiness...
No time! I've lost something! By any chance, have you seen a book lying around?

Fields.MenuText: Think you could narrow it down?
I haven't seen any book around here. Did you lose one?
So you're not going to apologize about my coffee... at all?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... it's hard to explain...
Oui, while I was trying to introduce one of the pilots to some of my combat training!
I admit that great people make mistakes, and I'm no exception to that rule. I will pay closer attention, sir!
I can't help if you don't specify what it is that you're missing.
It's a book in French!
And?
Just keep an eye out, okay! Now if you'll excuse me, I have things to do!
I've never seen her in such a rush before...
@BATTLE
Have you seen Béarn, sir?
Can't say that I have. Are you looking for her?
She said she was going to get me some wine and told me to meet her near your quarters.
How long have you been waiting?
About... an hour...

Fields.MenuText: Yeah. I know how you feel.
Why does she treat all of the pilots so differently from the crew?
She's probably trying to win the crew over. They found out that she spoils the pilots...

Fields.DialogueText: Really? That's a relief... last time she kept us waiting for almost the entire night. She gets caught up in things...
You know, I'm not sure. Though she won't stop telling us about how she was almost a battleship once...
Oh. That could be an issue. I hope we didn't cause too much trouble...
*ALARM*
Say, why would she tell me to meet her near your quarters?
I needed a referee so I could race the capitaine to the bridge!
Gah!
@BATTLE
Look at him go, Capitaine! Something tells me he'd beat both of us.
Do you have to just... appear like that?
I'd take you with me if I could. It is such a thrill!
Capitaine! What do you think of my hair?
It's braided.
It's beautiful, I know! Save your compliments, but it's another addition to my King Henri IV collection! Look, it's holding my hair together!

Fields.MenuText: You really do like that king, don't you?
It looks good. But why was King Henri IV great?
I wouldn't mind an ornament or two in my honor.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! He isn't called Good King Henri for nothing!
He regularized the state finance, drained some yucky swamps, and wanted people to be properly educated! He is a legend!
Now, Capitaine! Don't be jealous! Understand that my heart belongs to the late King Henri IV!
You have to be one of the most patriotic Belles I've ever heard of.
Thirteen years of my construction not only leads to a love for my nation, but brings me closer to elegance!
You're also the biggest boaster I've ever come across...
Non. I don't boast! I speak the truth!
*ALARM*
Let's give these Morganas a dose of truth.
@BATTLE
Morganas spotted, sir!
Action stations.
@BATTLE
An easy win! The Morganas are nothing compared to our might!
All right, everyone, give me a status report.
But before that, may I have your attention please? I have something that I need to say!
Béarn, what are you-
I have lost something incredibly important! A unique collection of stories that I'd like to be recovered!
Can't this wait?
If anyone finds a book in French, please find me or give it to the Captain! Make sure you... hm... oh! I forgot what I was going to say!
Captain, is she okay?

Fields.MenuText: She is... just keep an eye out for a book, okay?
I don't know. Just let her do her thing...
Just wait for her to finish, then we can get to business.

Fields.DialogueText: Will do, sir...
Sounds easy enough...
She may go on for a while. She does go off on tangents...
Capitaine, I think I'm ready!
Ready? For what?
To give you more information about my missing book, sir!
You're still on that? What can you tell me?
For one thing, it's a collection of short stories that was published in 1558!
Are you giving me hints? Do you want me to guess?
Allez! You should know that it's a very refined narrative for a cute lady like myself!

Fields.MenuText: This will go a lot quicker if you tell me the name of the book.
I don't know. Can we speed this up?
How am I supposed to narrow down my options with clues like that?

Fields.DialogueText: But... that wouldn't be fun!
Trust me, sir. I'm going as fast as I possibly can! You need to think harder!
It's so easy!
Can you just tell me the name?
I'd love to, but I gotta go give my pilots their wine!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Later, Béarn! Did you hear me?
I don't know... maybe I'm jealous...
You are. But, seriously, why should wine bother you?
Because we work hard, even more so than the pilots! I deserve some delicious rewards every now and then!
I can't believe this. Captain, are you hearing this?

Fields.MenuText: I am. Listen, eventually you can celebrate. Morganas come first.
We're in the midst of a war. Getting drunk should be your last priority.
I'll talk to Béarn. But this will be the only time, you understand?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, but why should her precious pilots get special treatment? We take care of Béarn more than they do!
It's not to the pilots! They're living the high life while we sit here and have watered down beverages!
I promise that this will be the only time, sir.
Unbelievable... I've never seen a crew act like this in all my years.
First time for everything...
But you will talk to Béarn... right?
Unbelievable...
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Are you two busy?
Bien sûr - of course we are! But you can come in. Tell me, do you want to hear some stories?
No, but this is about stories...
What do you mean?
I found this book by the medical bay. I couldn't understand any of the writing so I figured that one of you could decipher it...
Could it be?!
Excuse me?
It is! You found it! My book! My Tales of the Heptaméron!

Fields.MenuText: This is the book that you lost?
Now you say the name. Why couldn't you say it earlier?
So? No tangent? You don't want to regale us with its history?

Fields.DialogueText: Oui! It is! I'm at a loss for words!
Because it didn't feel right! I wanted it to remain a mystery! Now you're curious about it, aren't you?
Nah, I'm too excited!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
If it's got you this excited, it must be pretty thrilling. After the battle, though.
Heh... you might describe it that way, Capitaine...
To finally find my lost Tales of the Heptaméron... it's almost got that new book smell again!
You seem to have an immense attachment to it. What's it about?
It's... well... it's kind of embarrassing.
You? Embarrassed? Impossible.
It's just that a high-class woman shouldn't be caught reading this!

Fields.MenuText: Then you should be fine.
It's not often that I encourage you to start rambling.
If you don't want to tell me, that's fine. Now if you'll excuse me...

Fields.DialogueText: Grr... This rapier is not just for show!
Well... in that case...
No! Wait! You should hear about it!
... It's a romance!
That doesn't seem too bad.
Forbidden romance! Love triangles! Tales of awe and wonderment!
Why didn't you say so? I'd certainly like to-
There will be time later to educate you on how the French write a proper narrative. For now... violence!
@BATTLE
Not to mention cuckoldry and murder!
*ALARM*
Saved by the bell.
*ALARM*
These Morganas always have terrible timing.
@BATTLE
I'm regretting Béarn finding that book...
Why do you say that?
Because I've been waiting for her... again... and I just saw her earlier today, too.
So... can we talk about wine?
Sorry! I got caught up-
Talking about the book to an officer?
C'est vrai! How did you know?

Fields.MenuText: Because I know you, Béarn.
Not hard to guess. You haven't stopped evangelizing that book ever since you found it.
We need to talk about you and focusing...

Fields.DialogueText: I guess that's true, but am I that obvious?
But it really is a good book!
You always bring this up! I'm perfectly focused!
Let's see..."Your beauty, your graces, and your winning deportment merit so much pleasure..." Sound familiar, Capitaine?
Well, if you keep showing the book to everyone we'll never finish the story you were reading me.
Ah, oui! Where were we? "...The gentleman repaired by night to the queen's chamber, where he-"
N-not in front of the crew!
Morganas spotted to the east, Captain.
To your stations!
@BATTLE
Béarn, we need to chat about how to solve this problem with the pilots.
The crew is still upset about that?
It's all they talk about in the mess. It's making the sailors jealous.
Hmm... how am I going to solve this?
I don't want the crew constantly complaining.
Can I order some wine for a special occasion, then? Good wine, not the usual cheap swill the bean-counters make us settle for.

Fields.MenuText: Just this once. That applies to the pilots as well. No special treatment.
Whatever it takes, you have my permission.
There isn't another way out of this, is there?

Fields.DialogueText: Really? If it'll make this ship better... I'll do it.
I won't let you down!
I'm afraid not! But don't worry, I'm a smart enough Belle! I can solve this!
Think of it as a farewell dinner without the farewell.
So... dinner.
What I'm trying to say is that I've heard you and agree. It is pure nepotism to favor my pilots so. I will admit this at the dinner.
I'm glad you've come around.
I had a long talk with my sisters about it!
...The ones that are part of you.
So if it doesn't work, you can blame them.
Two steps forward...
Capitaine, I am sensing Morganas.
How close are they?
Too close.
@BATTLE
I'm sorry to do this! You know how generous I am!
It's okay, Béarn.
I know that you all look up to me and the last thing I want to do is let you down!
Béarn? What's going on here?
I was just apologizing profusely to my pilots!
And I was telling her that I completely understand.

Fields.MenuText: Glad to see you're following through with this. I'm proud of you.
So no more special wine deliveries?
That's another situation under control. Great work, Béarn.

Fields.DialogueText: R-really? I mean, of course you are!
Yep! Equal treatment from now on!
I always do great work, both on and off the battlefield!
Now if you'll excuse me, I was just about to talk to the pilot about some of my readings from last night!
Say, Captain, didn't you have a whole sack of potatoes for me to peel? Something menial that needed doing? Right away?
Why, I haven't the slightest idea what you're talking about.
Capitaine, you shall sit by my side at this dinner!
You said you had something special planned tonight?
I want to give them Béarnaise food while I share with them the history of my construction.
They already know it.
A history of my home!

Fields.MenuText: Just keep it under control, okay? The crew need their rest.
Whatever works for you.
Good idea. Then they'll be even more focused on the effort against the Morganas.

Fields.DialogueText: I will! I've never let you down before and I don't plan to now!
Trust my instincts, Capitaine! They never lead me astray!
That's the plan! I think it'll work out!
You're never going to tell me where you get your hands on this stuff, are you?
Hmm. I suppose I can let you in on the secret. The source is-
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Oh, dear, an interruption.
How do they always know?
Captain! We have reports of Mor-
*ALARM*
Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
So I was chatting with an officer the other day and I was telling him about my construction...
I think you've told me this before...
And I taught him French!
Béarn! Thanks for the introduction to Béarnaise food!
It's really good!
Don't get too attached! This is a one-time thing. It'll make you fight harder. Cherish it!
Will do!

Fields.MenuText: Once again, you're the most popular person on the ship.
You did it, Béarn.
Great job. Now they'll stay in high spirits.

Fields.DialogueText: They always adored me from the beginning, Capitaine!
I know I did! No surprises there!
I'll make sure I treat them all fairly from here on out!
I realized you were correct. We're fighting to keep the good things in life. If luxuries are always near, do they not become the new normal?
And then it's just about the haves versus the have-nots.
From now on, the best wine is for holidays only, and for everyone who wants it!
And if a certain captain wants a little extra?
Out of your pocket. But simply say the word and I'll find you the best in the region!
Sir, Morganas have been spotted.
Sound the alarm.
@BATTLE
You know, Béarn. You never told me.
Told you what?
Why you were giving special treatment to the pilots in the first place...
I didn't?
Nope.
Well you obviously know I was supposed to be a great battleship.
I'm well aware of that...
When I became an aircraft carrier, I figured that I needed to put the pilots first! To show them I cared!

Fields.MenuText: I guess that makes sense...
You don't need to do that, Béarn. The crew knows that we're all on the same team.
I'd think the captain would be due a little of that.

Fields.DialogueText: It does! I guess I forgot to pamper the crew, too...
Now I know! Thanks to you, sir!
Don't you start!
I'll say this, Béarn. You joke about your sisters taking the blame for your... eccentricity.
But the way I see it, you've got the kindness and energy of five Belles. Maybe that's literally true.
Capitaine, that... I'm so touched. Normandie, Flandre, Gascogne, Languedoc - I miss them sometimes, you know. Even though I never met them.
Sounds like you need to introduce the rest of us.
C'est décidé! I will dive into their histories with all the passion I find in mine.
That ought to give you some new reading material.
Indeed! My Heptaméron has been getting terribly worn...
Where is Béarn? We have Morganas inbound!
I'm not sure, sir.
Béarn?! Where are you?
Where is the Captain-oof!
There you are! Where have you been?!
I was looking for you, sir!
Really? I was looking for you!
No time to chitchat! We have Morganas to fight!
I'm supposed to say that to you...
@BATTLE
So-
So-
I think you might like-
I think you might like-

Fields.MenuText: ...You first.
May I proceed?
One at a time, Béarn.

Fields.DialogueText: Non, Capitaine, after you. I insist!
Please do!
Of course. You first!
I picked this up in port. Thought you might appreciate it.
Appreciate it? Capitaine, I love it! I've been meaning to read The Three Musketeers since...well, since I awoke.
Adventure, intrigue...and the main character's from Béarn. I thought it might be your kind of book.
Thank you, thank you, thank you! Although...well, I can't talk about your gift with everyone else here, remember? Because I got you a very special case of-
Ahem!
Ah! Almost let it slip. I suppose that's why I keep you around!
I'll take it.
